title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, June 5, 1896. A Word of Thanks

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, June 5, 1896. A WORD OF THANKS

body.p: I wish sincerely to thank all the societies that so willingly participated in the blessing of the bell of SS. Peter and Paul's Church.

I wish especially to thank the St. Casimir Military Society, the SS. Florian and George Krakus Society, the St. Martin Hussars, the Pulaski Volunteers, and the St. Adalbert Cadets. I also thank the St. Francis Xavier Society of the Blessed Virgin Mary of Perpetual Help parish of Bridgeport and the Uhlan Society and the Unity Society of the Town of Lake.
I am also heartily grateful to those societies which were unable to take part in the above celebration but sent generous contributions to help this young parish. The following made contributions:
Saint Joseph Society of the Blessed Virgin Mary of Perpetual Help parish, $20
St. Adalbert Society of the parish of that name, $10
Donations from St. Stanislaus Kostka's parish:
From the Holy Cross Society of Holy Trinity parish, $5
Society of the Most Sacred Heart of Mary, $5
I wish to thank all these societies with a sincere "God bless you!"
